item.title: Electoral College Map Animated
item.description:
Electoral College Map Animated
This is an animation of the United Stated Electoral College map including presidential winners (checkmarked), losers, and political parties. The video contains three versions of the animation: High speed, low speed, and then a medium speed view of the Republican era from Lincoln 1860 through Obama 2012. (Who cares about John Fremont—AMIRITE?!). Some interesting things to observe: - Solid South - Southern states voted Democrat very consistently from 1876 until about 1964. Nixon's "Southern strategy" helped switch the south to vote Republican. It's interesting to see how consistently blue those states are. - Whig Don't Do No Party - Although Whig party members drifted toward either the Republicans or Democrats, there's no consistent pattern in the electoral college. Them crazy Whigs. - Zany Elections - 1824 is a complete mess with four Democratic-Republicans running against each other including perennial loser Henry Clay. 1836 also had a large number of Whigs running against a Democrat (and the delightfully named Magnum, Independent.) There are two songs in here: 1. "La Ritournelle" by Sebastien Tellier from the album Politics (Astralwerks, 2004) 2. "Moving Force" by the Robert Fripp String Quartet from a bootleg recording.alternately titled Kan-Non Power or Soundscapes. The track is also available on the Robert Fripp & the League of Crafty Guitarists album Show of Hands, 1991. For more Sebastien Tellier music, check out his MySpace (MySpace?!) page: http://us.myspace.com/sebastientellier For more Frippian adventures, check out Discipline Global Mobile at www.dgmlive.com. For more of my schtuff, check out my other videos here or listen to my music at http://soundcloud.com/michael-hightower.
From: mphtower

item.title: Everybody's a Hitler Now
item.description:
Everybody's a Hitler Now
Hey kids, don't you love drawing Hitler mustaches on the pictures of politicians with whom you disagree? Sure, we all do! Well, this video is just for you. All of the photographs were found online—only the animation and music is by me. If you like the song, you can download it and other tracks by me at Soundcloud: http://soundcloud.com/michael-hightower/sets Big thanks to Skip Smith, my wife Lauren, and John Watson for being sounding boards while I put this together. You helped a lot! Lyrics, in case you're curious: Arguments have gone Hitler now When you disagree with someone, draw a swastika and li'l mustache on their picture. Obama, he's gone Hitler now. A Muslim Christian who isn't black enough A communist tool of business Who's from Kenya Mitt Romney, he's gone Hitler now A wealthy one-percenter who doesn't care about you A tax-cheat, a liar, who's all for cancer (Chorus) Everybody's a Hitler Now Everyone is a Nazi somehow When you say it's Sieg Heil to me Pelosi, she's gone Hitler now With Rick Santorum and Gingrich, Newt Hillary and Carter, and Putin, too And Netanyahu People are going Hitler now Meryl Streep as Thatcher and Chavez, too Elvis and Kermit, and What to do about Tom Cruise? (Chorus) Everybody's a Hitler Now Everyone is a Nazi somehow When you say it's Sieg Heil to me This tree, this cat, this dog David Hasselhoff Yu-gi-oh and Jay Leno Your neighbors and you and me And this cookie (Chorus x 4)

item.title: Frightfully Clean
item.description:
Frightfully Clean
Washing your hands before returning to work has never been more terrifying! The hapless Morris Williams is working late on a project... a project that is destined to never be completed when he makes the mistake of confronting the new touch-free soap dispenser in the office lavatory. Frightfully Clean is the latest film from Conhugeco, the makers of Baby Got Back - Gilbert and Sullivan Style and Cancer Has Become the Number One Killer Disease. This is another Mike Hightower thingy, with Skip Smith playing Morris Williams. Thanks to all the folks who helped this come together, and thanks to everyone who's watched these short films.

item.title: Ghost Adventures Shadow Hand ANALYZED!
item.description:
Ghost Adventures Shadow Hand ANALYZED!
On the November 21st episode of Ghost Adventures, Zak had a moment of panic when he saw a ghostly hand and was struck by an orb of light. What really happened? Was it coincidence, a bug, or something more? This analysis by Michael Hightower clearly illustrates the shocking truth of the Ghost Adventures' Shadowy Hand. Be sure to watch Ghost Adventures on the Travel Channel, Fridays at 9pm ET! (Please don't get angry at me Cox Communications, Travel Channel, or anyone else involved.) UPDATE 10/26/09: I do not call this a "debunk" video, as that implies I think this stuff could be bunk. I do believe that there's something going on that we call ghosts and that it is not just some mental aberration. With that said, I want good strong evidence that this stuff exists. The footage from GA was compelling enough that I wanted to see if this could be very solid evidence. Turns out no, but that doesn't mean we shouldn't keep investigating. I'ma gonna tape the Halloween episode. I hope something good comes out of it. At the least, we know it won't be edited later on as this footage was.

item.title: A Really Brief History of the Universe
item.description:
A Really Brief History of the Universe
NASA animations put to an original score. This was a project for work to simply introduce our new Oracle db, but obviously I got pretty into it. I say original score, but let's face it--you can tell I dig Philip Glass. Though, that worked for John Adams, so maybe I shouldn't complain. Higher quality version is available at www.mphtower.com. Hopefully new funny stuff will be coming out later, but I hope you enjoy this for now. Yer ole buddy, Mike

item.title: Baby Got Back - Gilbert and Sullivan Style
item.description:
Baby Got Back - Gilbert and Sullivan Style
Update! You can download the song (as well as other stuff I've written) at my website: http://www.mphtower.com/home/music The advent of time warp technology offered to Knights of the British Empire has allowed this uniquely satisfying look at Sirs Gilbert and Sullivan's re-envisioning of fellow Sir Mix-A-Lot's Baby Got Back. O! What a joy it is for us to hear these three titans working in concert for the first time, and hopefully not the last. Score/Retro-editing: Mike Hightower Add'l Vox: Jeanne Newman and Kendra (whose last name I don't know) For more music and videos, go to www.mphtower.com.

item.title: The Aristocrats! - As Edited for TV
item.description:
The Aristocrats! - As Edited for TV
Hi-quality version here: www.mphtower.com/videos Hey kids! Wish mom and dad would let you see The Aristocrats movie?! Well now you can, because this version of an Aristocrats sketch has been edited for TV broadcast, and all the grown-up words have been censored. Finally you can stop talking to creepy adults online, and just watch them. Background: This was my losing entry for Be An Aristocrat video contest. The uncensored version shall not be available publicly, which is fine, because this one makes me laugh more. Wish I'd thought of it earlier.

item.title: Coming In Like El Nino
item.description:
Coming In Like El Nino
Hi-quality version here: www.mphtower.com/videos Are you too proud to appease the Peruvian gods? Well, Mr. Person Who Fishes For A Living, maybe that's why you keep getting flooded. This is a paper originally by a Jeremy Lavine (Period 3). I assume it's real, but a friend found it online. Perhaps the mystery shall never be solved. Speaking of mysteries, why am I receiving ladies' panties in my mail box?

item.title: Cancer Has Become the Number One Killer Disease
item.description:
Cancer Has Become the Number One Killer Disease
Hi-quality version here: www.mphtower.com/videos Have you been coughing and of strongly breath? Have you had conditions that are not conditions to see? Are you in the most dangerous step? Then you might be receiving cancer! In 2002, the lovely Miss V., a professor at a notable New England university received the future classic "Cancer Has Become the Number One Killer Disease" student paper from the astonishingly named Pisit Pornkitti. Due to her remarkable foresight, and a fellow professor's scanner, we at Conhugeco Films are proud to bring you an informative video version of this landmark paper. Don't be panic!
